item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Tim Gunn
item.description: "Make it work" -- Tim Gunn

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Thunder is good, thunder is impressive; but it is lightening that does the work." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Of all the animals, man is the only one that is cruel. He is the only one that inflicts pain for the pleasure of doing it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Often it does seem such a pity that Noah and his party did not miss the boat." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There was never yet an uninteresting life. Such a thing is an impossibility. Inside of the dullest exterior there is a drama, a comedy, and a tragedy." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Plain question and plain answer make the shortest road out of most perplexities." -- Mark Twain

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description: "It's fear that makes us lose our conscience. It's also what transforms us into cowards." -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "The lyf so short, the craft so long to lerne." -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "Ful wys is he that kan himselve knowe." -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Anthony Robbins
item.description: "Identify your problems but give your power and energy to solutions" -- Anthony Robbins

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Anthony Robbins
item.description: "The path to success is to take massive, determined action." -- Anthony Robbins

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "A human being should be able to change a diaper, plan an invasion, butcher a hog, conn a ship, design a building, write a sonnet, balance accounts, build a wall, set a bone, comfort the dying, take orders, give orders, cooperate, act alone, solve equations, analyze a new problem, pitch manure, program a computer, cook a tasty meal, fight efficiently, die gallantly. Specialization is for insects." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description:
"It's been suggested that if the super-naturalists really had the powers they claim, they'd win the lottery every week. I prefer to point out that they could also win a Nobel Prize for discovering fundamental physical forces hitherto unknown to science. Either way, why are they wasting their talents doing party turns on television?
By all means let's be open-minded, but not so open-minded that our brains drop out." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "How many legs does a dog have if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "I am no fan of books." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "I am no fan of books. And chances are, if you're reading this, you and I share a healthy skepticism about the printed word. Well, I want you to know that this is the first book I've ever written, and I hope it's the first book you've ever read. Don't make a habit of it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Meow” means “woof” in cat." -- George Carlin

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house." -- George Carlin

item.title: BrainBackBend add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "I went to a bookstore and asked the saleswoman, 'Where's the self-help section?' She said if she told me, it would defeat the purpose." -- George Carlin
